pullRequest.body:
We define the support of a module as a `Set (PrimeSpectrum R)`.
We prove various results about it including `Supp M = ∅ ↔ M = 0` and that `Supp M` is closed for finite modules.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Support`|1113|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.PrimeSpectrum.Module`|1290|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LinearEquiv.support_eq`
`+ LocalizedModule.exists_subsingleton_away`
`+ LocalizedModule.mem_ker_mkLinearMap_iff`
`+ LocalizedModule.subsingleton_iff`
`+ LocalizedModule.subsingleton_iff_disjoint`
`+ LocalizedModule.subsingleton_iff_ker_eq_top`
`+ LocalizedModule.subsingleton_iff_support_subset`
`+ Module.annihilator_le_of_mem_support`
`+ Module.isClosed_support`
`+ Module.mem_support_iff`
`+ Module.mem_support_iff'`
`+ Module.mem_support_iff_exists_annihilator`
`+ Module.mem_support_iff_of_finite`
`+ Module.mem_support_iff_of_span_eq_top`
`+ Module.not_mem_support_iff`
`+ Module.not_mem_support_iff'`
`+ Module.stableUnderSpecialization_support`
`+ Module.support`
`+ Module.support_eq_empty`
`+ Module.support_eq_empty_iff`
`+ Module.support_eq_zeroLocus`
`+ Module.support_of_algebra`
`+ Module.support_of_exact`
`+ Module.support_of_noZeroSMulDivisors`
`+ Module.support_subset_of_injective`
`+ Module.support_subset_of_surjective`
`+ Module.support_subset_preimage_comap`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
Thanks! Can you add short description to the PR?
Done.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10043968195/job/27757911512)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10043968195/job/27757912455)
What results here actually require the Zariski topology?
That the support is closed in the zariski topology.

`AlgebraicGeometry.PrimeSpectrum.Basic` was recently split into `RingTheory.PrimeSpectrum` (no topology) and `AlgebraicGeometry.PrimeSpectrum.Basic` (topology). We were getting some crazy dependencies otherwise. I think it would be good to the same here. This is a pretty basic commutative algebraic concept.

Some part of it relies on `PrimeSpectrum.comap` and `PrimeSpectrum.basicOpen` that is in `AlgebraicGeometry.PrimeSpectrum.Basic` though. I've moved those results out into a separate file for now but do you think it makes sense to have unbundled versions of `PrimeSpectrum.comap` and `PrimeSpectrum.basicOpen` that does not depend on the topology?
I think it makes sense but can be done later.

```suggestion

-- Basic files in `RingTheory` should avoid depending on the Zariski topology
-- See `AlgebraicGeometry/PrimeSpectrum/Module`
assert_not_exists TopologicalSpace

```

```suggestion
    exact ⟨_, ⟨n, rfl⟩, (Submodule.mem_annihilator_span_singleton _ _).mp hn⟩
```
seems ok

```suggestion
variable {R M : Type*} [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M]
```

If it is easy, it is better to avoid level metavariables in `R` and `M`.

```suggestion
variable {R A M : Type*} [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M] 
  [CommRing A] [Algebra R A] [Module A M]
```

```suggestion
variable {R M : Type*} [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M]
```
Is there a reason to repeat `{p}` so much instead of `{p : PrimeSpectrum R}` here?
Fixed. Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Support): Define support of a module
